definition: ocean/sea/CL:個|个[ge4],片[pian4]/great number of people or things/(dialect) numerous

sentences.english: The Southern Aral, however, still remains a shadow of its former self.
sentences.chinese: 然而，咸海的南部依然一如既往。

sentences.english: Satellite image of the Aral Sea used to be the fourth largest lake in the world
sentences.chinese: 卫星图像显示咸海曾经是世界上第四大湖泊。

sentences.english: The drying is due to overuse of the lake's feeder rivers.
sentences.chinese: 咸海的干涸是由于汇入咸海的河流被过度使用。

sentences.english: The drying is due to overuse of the lake's feeder rivers.
sentences.chinese: 咸海的干涸是由于汇入咸海的河流被过度使用。

sentences.english: The shrinking Aral Sea has also had a noticeable affect on the region's climate.
sentences.chinese: 消失中的咸海也对当地气候产生了明显影响。

sentences.english: Its mismanagement is regarded as one of the world's worst environmental disasters.
sentences.chinese: 咸海管理不善被认为世界最严重的环境灾难之一。

sentences.english: By 2000 the Northern and Southern Aral Sea had already separated.
sentences.chinese: 2000年的时候咸海的北部和南部水域就已经断开。

sentences.english: Baikonur lies by the 16)Syrdarya River, dangerously close to the 17)Aral Sea.
sentences.chinese: 拜科努尔位于锡尔河畔，靠近咸海，危机四伏。

sentences.english: The Aral Sea gets almost all its water from the Amu and Syr rivers.
sentences.chinese: 咸海的水源几乎完全来自阿姆河和锡尔河。

definition: Amu Darya, the biggest river of Central Asia, from Pamir to Aral sea, forming the boundary between Afghanistan and Tajikistan then flowing through Turkmenistan and Uzbekistan/formerly called Oxus by Greek and Western writers, and Gihon by medieval Islamic writers
Syr Darya, Central Asian river, flowing from Kyrgiz Republic through Kazakhstan to the Aral sea
Talas River, originating in Kyrgyzstan and flowing west into Kazakhstan
old name for the Pamir high plateau 帕米爾高原|帕米尔高原[Pa4 mi3 er3 Gao1 yuan2] on the border between Xinjiang and Tajikistan
Tarim Basin depression in southern Xinjiang
the Ferghana Valley in modern Uzbekistan
pinyin: Fei4 er3 gan4 na4 Pen2 di4
